Experience Sr Commodity Manager SanDisk September 2014  – Present (1 year) Milpitas, CA Supply Chain ownership for SanDisk’s Consumer Solid State Drive's new product team. Responsible for sourcing, commodity and factory management to achieve cost, quality and delivery objectives. Commodity Business Manager Applied Materials March 2013  –  September 2014  (1 year 7 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Global supplier management of $225M revenue across US, Asia and Europe locations. 
• Developed Executive messaging for long term site sustainability based on extensive on-site evaluation. 
• Continuing management of operations, backlog order reduction, on-time delivery improvement, improved communication and organizational structure. 
• Accountable for operations, resource planning, product allocation, capacity management and commercial negotiations across all global sites. 
• Manage conflict resolution leading to joint success within organization and across supply base. 
• Contract management of Global Sales Agreements, Non-Disclosure Agreements, Inventory and Claim Strategies. Sr Materials Project Manager Applied Materials July 2007  –  February 2013  (5 years 8 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Managed multiple product lines Gate, Epi, Implant and CVD within Front End Products group. Second level escalation point for Gate products (mentoring and managing team member). Responsibilities included R&D development of 3 new chamber products; legacy cost reduction (influencing engineering) and proposed cost increase mitigation/recommendations. 
• Critical key negotiator for cost avoidance collaborating with suppliers across multiple programs leading to $329k cost avoidance in 2012 and increase mitigations based on strategic proposals, creative solutions and out of the box alternatives. 
• Coordinated key critical supplier visits in Japan with Program Manager and Director of Engineering. Team met with suppliers to discuss new product introduction, forecasting, raw material strategies and capacity allocation. Benefit of supplier visits lead to reduced lead times, key contacts, improved relationships, increased leverage and competitive cost reduction. 
• Drove key sourcing activities defining leverage by identifying capable alternate suppliers. Lead to competitive quoting and Engineering should costing which defined annual savings of $300k across three projects within one program.  
• Lead commercial negotiation with supplier charging spot buy pricing for production released assemblies. Negotiations led to providing alternative pricing from sub-tier supplier was proven should cost. Current Supplier chose to retain sub-tier supplier honoring cost reduction, which lead to $350k in annual savings. 
• Formed global project team for recovery of 11% cost increase on a major module assembly. Drove global project team to put together a plan for cost mitigation. Lead task force consisting of regular meetings, visited supplier in Singapore and completed follow-up with internal executive management team for closure status/recommendations. Results lead to plans to meet 90% of requested raw material and machining cost increase, an annual cost avoidance of $450k. Sr Business Planner National Semiconductor November 2005  –  June 2007  (1 year 8 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Forecasted i2 demand planning revenue for two Analog Portable Power Management product families, equating to $66M in average quarterly revenue. Create and drive the supply direction to FAB and Assembly/Test production facilities for wafer start generation and product finished good categorization to meet customer demand forecast and near-term backlog. 
• Managed product life-cycles for 400 Portable Power products through new product introduction, high volume manufacturing and inventory end-of-life strategies. This includes development of weeks-of-inventory goals, planning system maintenance, product definition alignment and BOM/BOR management. 
• Established and maintained product lead-times across all products highlighting product availability to customers. Drive manual customer order scheduling for engineering sample requirements to support new product introduction. 
• Managed daily factory loading execution by determining i2 forecast type definitions based on product life-cycles. Complete accountability for all inventories across the supply chain, yields/bin projection, guaranteed safety stock quantities and Vendor Managed Inventory program support. Logistics Supervisor Intel Corporation January 2005  –  November 2005  (11 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Managed a 15-person logistics/warehousing team consisting of three operations across two facilities. Responsible for operational execution/excellence, employee development and world-wide business partner logistics support. 
• Managed an ESD transponder finished goods distribution center and shipping/receiving operations. Team responsible for inventory cycle counting, SAP order management and logistics inbound/outbound shipments. 
• Managed a factory shipping/receiving operations for FAB finished/non-finished goods, mask reticle and silicon distribution. Team responsible for carrier/transportation management for inbound/outbound logistics. Weekly average: 1,500 receivables and 475 shipments (140 international / 335 domestic). 
• Managed 38,000 sq ft warehouse facility used for all marketing trade show storage and distribution. Team responsible for inventory tracking, capacity management and carrier distribution for world-wide trade show material. 
• Partnered with transportation to identify low cost carriers for world-wide shipments. Team worked with tax, licensing and customs departments to ensure international shipments met governed regulations prior to shipping. Project Manager Intel Corporation January 2003  –  January 2005  (2 years 1 month) San Francisco Bay Area • Supported planning to define business process requirements, developed project goals and delivered training for software implementation. Team created Web Based GUI for monthly demand forecast and product alignment. 
• Managed engineering conversions for Desktop, Mobile and Server/Workstation CPU product lines. Responsible for business partner negotiation, new product sampling, product life-cycle management and customer issue resolution. 
• Drove monthly product discontinuance meetings to review marketing CPU product guidance and upcoming end-of-life milestones to gathering end customers final demand requirements. 
• Drove sales team meetings working with business partners in Asia Pacific, Japan, Europe and North/South America. Responsible for sharing product conversion, product sampling and product discontinuance information. Business Planner Intel Corporation October 2000  –  January 2003  (2 years 4 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Created Assembly/Test finished good build plans for Mobile CPU business equating to $225M in average quarterly revenue and Server/Workstation CPU business product lines equating to $220M in average quarterly revenue. 
• Project Manager for Pentium® III product conversion from CPU to the embedded organization estimated $600k in cost savings. Designed Gantt chart highlighting resource, planning, product and project requirements. Transitioned a staff of nine planners in CA to three planners in AZ. Evaluated planning processes and adjusted systems to meet supply and resource requirements. 
• Partnered with marketing on product speed to market by highlighting current yields and factory bottlenecks that could potentially gate timing for new product launches. Worked with manufacturing counterparts to understand capacity limitations and product priorities within the factory to support the launch of new product introductions (NPI).  
• Drove planning and roadmap strategies by leading world-wide meetings with manufacturing across Assembly/Test locations to provide corporate strategic build guidance to support weekly supply schedules. Product Supply Planner Intel Corporation April 2000  –  October 2000  (7 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Managed SAP order management, partnered with marketing on the management of the corporate order allocation for the Desktop Celeron® CPU processors. Ensured sales teams aligned backlog within allocation based on demand. 
• Provided planning management with daily supply vs. backlog request analysis to ensure delinquent customer requirements were supported. Partnered with Business Planning to align customer orders and daily supply closures for order allocation.  
• Worked directly with sales organizations across Asia Pacific, Japan, Europe and North/South America to manage inventory levels across various product conversions on multiple engineering product revisions. 
• Partnered with finance and marketing to help identify excess to demand inventory and pursued additional markets and channel opportunities for depletion. Manufacturing Technician Intel Corporation July 1997  –  April 2000  (2 years 10 months) Phoenix, Arizona Area • Worked in a fast paced team environment supporting manufacturing operations to meet factory shift work in process (WIP) turns while operating systems and tools using lean manufacturing strategies. 
• Worked as a Process Technician directly dispositioning material and reported risk assessments to product engineering. 
• Partnered with engineering on process improvement opportunities within the Pentium®, Pentium® II and Pentium® III ramp. 
• Drove cross-training opportunities within functional areas leading to improved team moral and successful process certifications.
